loans.name: Castillitos De Arena Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” es un grupo que iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho personas, 1 varón y 7 mujeres.

La asociación comunal “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Fidelia , la tesorera la señora  Elizabeth y como secretaria de actas la señora Vanesa.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos:  venta de ropa, comerciante de tejidos, carpintería, comerciante de diversos productos de acuerdo a la época, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y cosméticos, promotora de productos de belleza.
En el caso de la señora  Fidelia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  desde hace cinco años tiene como negocio la venta de ropa, sus familiares le enseñaron a desenvolverse en este negocio.  La señora Fidelia  realiza las ventas en la Zona 16 de Julio, Ex tranca (Av. Juan Pablo II),  Ceja de El Alto,en diferentes días, recibe la colaboración de su pareja para traladar la mercadería y vender. El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para comprar ropa para niños y surtir los productos a la venta.

La señora Fidelia es una mujer de  26 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace tres años, ingresó al grupo gracias a la invitación de una amiga.   

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación, la atención en salud.  Tuvo la oportunidad de recibir control prenatal en consultorio y opinó que fue buena.
texts.en:
The “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” (Little Sand Castles) communal bank is starting its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members: 1 man and 7 women.

The “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” communal bank set up its governing body thus:  Fidelia is President, Elizabeth is Treasurer and Vanesa is Recording Secretary.  The businesses of the members are varied.  They are in commerce, service and production.  Among them are: clothing sales, weavings sales, carpentry, seasonal items sales, cosmetics sales, food and cosmetics sales, beauty products sales.

Fidelia, communal bank President, indicates that she has been selling clothing for the last five years.  Her family taught her how to carry out this kind of business.  Fidelia sells in the 16 de Julio zone, Tranca Extension (John Paul II Avenue), Ceja de El Alto, on different days.  Her spouse helps her transport the merchandise and with sales.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy children’s clothes to stock for sale.

Fidelia is 26 years old living with her spouse and their three children.  She’s collaborated with Pro Mujer for three years having been invited to join by a girl friend.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and health services.  She had to opportunity to get prenatal care in the clinic and her opinion was that it was good.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Mecxintle Group

texts.es: OLGA P. C. INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO MECXINTLE, (CUYO NOMBRE SIGNIFICA LUNA),RECIBIÓ SU TERCER CRÉDITO EN LA INSTITUCIÓN, EN LA CUAL ELLA ESTÁ MUY AGUSTO, DE HECHO HA REALIADO BUENOS PAGOS. EL CRÉDITO HA SIDO DE GRAN BENEFICIO YA QUE GRACIAS A ELLO A REALIZADO LA COMPRA DE MÁS MERCANCÍAS (GARRAFONES DE BARRO PARA ENFRIAR EL AGUA, COMALES PARA LA TORTILLAS CAZUELAS DE DIFERENTES TAMAÑOS, FIGURAS DECORATIVAS (SOLES). LA SEÑORA SE SIENTE MUY AGRADECIDA CON ESTE TIPO DE PPROGRAMAS POR QUE GRACIAS A ELLO HA MEJORADO LA SITUACION ECONOMICA FAMILIAR. LAS OPORTUNIDADES DE COMERCIALIZAR SU MERCANCIAS SON MAS AMPLIAS YA QUE PARA ESTAS SEMANAS SALDRÁ A AMECAMECA EDO DE MEXICO PARA IR A LA FERIA Y VENDER ALLI SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en: Olga P. C. is a member of the Mexintle (Moon) Group.  She has received her third loan through this institution and has been a very good loan client, always making her payments on time.  The loan has been of great benefit to her and she has been able to buy more merchandise (clay pitchers for cooling water, different sizes of comales for tortillas, and decorative sun figurines).  She is very thankful for this type of program that has helped improve her economic situation at home.  She has a lot of opportunities to sell her products and in the coming weeks will go to Amecameca in Mexico state to go the fair and sell her products.

loans.use: To buy materials for clay water pots

loans.name: Tierra Fertil (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tierra fértil está conformado por un grupo de 11 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades en su comunidad o en la ciudad, las que les permiten crecer economícamente y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia se puede admirar hermosos paisajes de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y cordial quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Jeannette Pilatuña vive por la comunidad de Cochapamba en la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta porque en él tiene muy buenas amigas. Nuestra socia trabaja como empleada privada en una clínica de la ciudad ya que es enfermera, actividad en la que labora hace 5 años y trabaja en turnos rotativos. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes.
Doña Jeannette tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad que  estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo vive en casa de un familiar. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el arreglo del galpón para sus cuyes. Su meta es darle a su hija una buena educación para que ella pueda salir  adelante.

La Señora. Mónica C. vive por la comunidad de Cochapamba en la parroquia del Valle, tiene 34 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija vive con su papá y su segundo hijo quien es discapacitado vive en su casa y estudia en una escuelita para niños especiales. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Mónica se dedica al comercio, vende cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, esta actividad la realiza sin un horario y hace 5 años. También tiene una tienda en su casa hace 6 años y en ella trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su prima, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para la tienda y así tener un mejor surtido para su clientela. Su meta es  agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Tierra Fértil” (Fertile Land) is a group that consists of eleven women and three men who work in different businesses within their community or in the city. This enables them to grow financially and move their families forward. The members live in the parish of El Valle, which is admired for its beautiful natural landscapes and the friendly cordial people who engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

Sra. Jeannette Pilatuña lives in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. She is receiving her fifth loan from the Communal Bank. Jeannette enjoys being a member because she has made many good friends. She has worked for a private clinic in the city as a nurse for five years. Jeannette works in rotating shifts and also raises guinea pigs from her home.

Doña Jeannette is 31 years old, single, and has a seven year old daughter who attends school in the city. She does not have a house of her own, so she lives at the home of a relative. The money from her loan will be invested in repairs to the pen where she keeps her guinea pigs. Her goal is to give her daughter a good education so that she can get ahead.

Sra. Mónica C. lives in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has two children (ages 18 and 17). Her first child, a daughter, lives with her father while her second child, a son, lives with her at home since he is disabled. He attends a school for special needs children. Through her work, Mónica was able to build her own home.

Doña Mónica is a merchant who sells cosmetics from the Yanbal line. She has worked in this business without a set schedule for five years. In addition, she has a store in her home that she managed for six years. She works in this business Sunday to Sunday from 8am to 8pm. This is the first loan she has received from the Communal Bank and she was invited by her cousin. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more products for her store so that she can have a better inventory for her customers. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Make repairs to a guinea pig pen

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHASQUIS” (Chasqui es el nombre que se le daba al encargado de llevar las noticias de un extremo a otro del imperio de los Incas, se entiende como “corredor veloz”) es un grupo que iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Est asociación comunal está compuesta por ocho personas, 1 varón y 7 mujeres.

La A.C. “CHASQUIS” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Basilia, la tesorera la señora  Sonia y como secretaria de actas la señora María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: venta de juguetes, elaboración de mantas, costura de bolsas, chofer de transporte público, venta de pollos a la broster, tienda de barrio.

En el caso de la señora  Basilia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio, desde hace diez años,  ella comenta que siempre tuvo la idea de contar con una tienda y así lo hizo, sin ayuda de nadie.  La señora Basilia atiende su tienda de lunes a lunes de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, las compras para surtir el negocio son realizadas en zonas comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para comprar mercadería para la tienda, conservas, víveres y otros.

La señora Basilia  es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace tres ciclos, ingresó al grupo gracias a la invitación de los promotores.   

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación y el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Chasquis” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. (“Chasqui” is the name given to a messenger who carried news from one end of the Incan empire to the other, and is understood to mean “fast runner”.) This Communal Association consists of eight members, one man and seven women.

The Chasquis Communal Association has its Board of Directors organized in the following manner: Sra. Basilia – President, Sra. Sonia – Treasurer, and Sra. María – Secretary of Records. The members engage in various businesses in the retail, service, and manufacturing sectors so that they can get ahead. These include selling toys, weaving blankets, sewing handbags, driving public transportation vehicles, selling roasted chickens, and managing neighborhood stores.

Such is the case of Sra. Basilia, the President of the Communal Association. She says that she has been managing a neighborhood store for ten years. Basilia states that she always had the idea to open a store, so she proceeded to do so without any assistance. She manages her store Monday to Monday from 6am to 9pm. The inventory to restock her business is purchased in the commercial districts of the city of El Alto. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her store such as canned goods, groceries, and other items.

Sra. Basilia is a 42 years old woman who lives with her husband and son. She joined Pro Mujer as a result of an invitation from the program promoters and has participated in three loan cycles. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Basilia says she enjoys the training sessions and the loans.

loans.use: Purchase canned goods, groceries, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a vegetable farm. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.  Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she could have additional funds to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her vegetable farm.  This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Enriqueta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 53-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a tricycle transport business.  She lives in the municipality of Tuburan, Cebu. Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to purchase some goods for her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Liza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en: Ronita is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a vegetable farm. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her vegetable farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Ronita is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ronita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a married woman who lives in Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Anecio, who is 59 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 20 to 41 years old. Melly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 as more funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Melly is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

Her husband Nilo, who is 56 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 9 to 25 years old. Perlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase fishing equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Perlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Just like her fellow community partners in CCT*, Paulina A., 58, is determined to get only the best in life. One disappointment she has was not going to college; now, she is firm in her decision not to have any more major regrets in life. 

Paulina is married to Carlos, a supervisor. They live as a family in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

Paulina runs her own sari-sari (variety) store in their community. She has done so for five years, and her neighbors already are familiar with how she conducts her business. Paulina wants to know what her customers want and aims to meet those preferences. She carefully chooses her products and sells them attractively, earning around 10,000 Philippines pesos (PhP) per month.

Knowing that she needs more finances to keep her business growing, Pauline applied for a Php12,000 loan. She plans to use this to purchase essential goods, such as shampoo, soap, instant noodles, biscuits, and drinks, which her regular customers typically look for. The loan helps in leveraging the profitability of her store and allows her to pay their bills and buy what her family wants.

Tough competition within the vicinity, low sales at certain times of the year, and unpaid debts by some customers are just a few of the problems Paulina has. But she refuses to let these hurdles keep her from obtaining the best she could have. She holds on to her dream of acquiring their own lot, building their own house, having a bigger store with wholesale products, and buying their own car.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing salable items for her store

loans.name: Anna Victoria

texts.en:
Just as she is taught in her entrepreneurial training as a community partner in CCT, Anna Victoria C., 36, chooses not to settle for anything less than what she can get. She is only a high school graduate but at present she has a business she can call her own. Anna is married to Bobby, a printing operator. They have four children of which three are already studying. The youngest is still not of school age. Their family resides in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

Anna’s business centers on electronic load for mobile phones. She capitalizes on the huge demand for mobile communication and the means to be connected to others via call or text. She sells electronic load for Smart, Globe, and Sun network clients. Also, she buys and sells biscuits like choco chips in the neighborhood. With no assistants hired to help her, she is able to earn 11,000 Philippine pesos monthly.

To level up her business, she borrowed 11,000 PHP. This will greatly help her grow her business as she needs more money on hand to stock load for sale. With this loan, she can be assured that she will not run out of load to sell to customers who need it anytime of the day. Also, she plans to venture into the rice selling business, as rice is also a sought-after commodity elsewhere in the country. The loan also helps her save up and be able to buy things her children need.

The problem of lacking finances to stock electronic load for retailing pushed Anna to get a loan and set things right in her business. She also finds it hard to collect payments from neighbors with long lists of debts. Her health is also one major problem. Nevertheless, the encouragement she gains from the fellowship in CCT helps her not to lose hope. She dreams of having a bigger store and a bigger home which they can really call their own. To reach this goal, she looks for other possible sources of income. Just like any other parent, it is her desire to see her children finish their studies.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase electronic load for retailing

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Coming right from her mouth, Sonia P., 53, admits to being a simple person who lives her life for others. Sonia is a community partner of CCT* in Pasay City. She has no family of her own; nevertheless, her siblings and friends consider themselves blessed because of her. Sonia reached college and is now dedicated to making her business reach new heights.

Sonia rents out the rooms in her house to boarders – students, working professionals and transients.  She has been in this business for 12 years now; so, she has quite a good grasp of managing rooms well and keeping a good, relaxing ambiance in the house. As well, her personality jives with the different individual clients she gets to meet. Monthly she is able to earn 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Because she is taking her business to new heights, Sonia decided to borrow 25,000 PHP. This is a great help to her business, as she needs the money to buy additional materials, such as metal, cement and other construction materials, to improve the room facilities. She really wants to make the rooms look better and to add more to accommodate more clients. Because the loan enables her to shape up her business, she is also able to give financially to siblings who do not have work.

At present, Sonia battles a health problem, as her stomach frequently hurts. Her head also aches with clients who do not pay their dues on time; sometimes, not at all! Still, these are not enough to stop Sonia from reaching new business heights. She desires to level up her rental services from rooms to a condominium. She plans on buying her own lot and building another house. She dreams of having her own car. Of course, she also has a dream for her siblings. Simple as she is, she wants to be of assistance to them and to others even in the years to come.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Renovation of rooms for rent

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
With the death of a loved one, a person does not stop living. Mamerta S., age 61, still has something to live for even without her husband at her side any more. Maita, as she is called by fellow community partners in CCT*, reached high school level during her educational years; at present, she devotes her time to running her own small business. She has her seven children to continue living for. Maita’s family resides in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

A sari-sari (variety) store serves as Maita’s main source of income. With it, she strives to meet the immediate needs of her community as she makes every effort to earn income for her family. The store is residential and is thus accessible to the family. Maita has been running a sari-sari store for 25 years now; she did so even when her husband Valentin, also a vendor, was still living. Monthly, Maita earns Php 12,000 on average.

To help her grow her business, Maita loans Php 10,000. She will make good use of the loan by purchasing products that are in demand in their location, such as the vinegar and coal used by some families to prepare their meals. Maita says the loan also enables her to give to family members when an emergency arises. 

The challenge Maita has to face is the selling of products that are not much in demand, such as canned goods. People in her community are not much into buying these goods, as they prefer cooking their own meals. But one good thing is that Maita can focus on making her business efficient, as she currently has no significant personal problems. She desires to make her business more profitable in order to be able to help others. She hopes that her sari-sari store will grow into a grocery, so that she will be able to renovate her commercial space as well as their house. Most of all, she prays that her children will become successful and have their own growing businesses.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase such items as coal and vinegar for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Experiencing the struggles coming from a separation is not easy, and Asuncion C., age 51, can testify to that. Still, Asuncion manages to stay on her feet and make the best of what she has now. She finished college and is now running her own micro enterprise. Asuncion has two children who are both in college. They reside in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

A small sari-sari (variety) store is what Asuncion focuses on as the primary source of income for the family. She observes which products are mostly in demand, which brands are preferred, and which needs of the community have yet to be met. The store is located at their home and she runs it on her own. With this small business Asuncion is able to earn Php 12,000 per month.

To help her grow her business, she would like to request a Php 32,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more quantities of quality products to add to her stock in the sari-sari store. The loan will be very helpful in sustaining the store and it allows Asuncion to provide for the needs of her children, including providing their daily allowances.

Asuncion has faced a lot of problems lately. She has no hired person to look after her store. That is why when she has an important task to do outside home, she is forced to close the store. She also carries the burden of providing for the needs of her family, now that her husband isn’t around to depend on. Nevertheless, Asuncion stands strong, knowing that the best is yet to come for her family. She makes the best of running her business in order to be able to finance the studies of her children up until college. She desires eventually to acquire another space for her business.

As a CCT* community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of quality products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma is a 34-year-old hardworking woman. She lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver in a private company, having worked for a public transportation company for nine years. Javzanpagma has a 4-year-old son who goes to kindergarten and a 14-year-old daughter in secondary school. Javzanpagma started her business in 2004 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, Mongolia's biggest raw materials outdoor market, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. In 2007, she bought a semi-automatic cutting machine for 3,000,000 MNT to produce firewood. Javzanpagma buys raw materials from the wood truck which comes from the countryside and sells the firewood. As a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 6,500,000 MNT.

Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy more wood this season as the price will be lower compared to summer. Therefore she can buy wood at a low price and produce firewood to sell at a higher price in the summer. Javzanpagma wants her children to get an excellent education and her purpose for the upcoming year is to build a new small house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a vegetable and fish vendor. He and his wife have three children between the ages of seven and 16 years old. They hope to provide their children with good educations to the university level. His business is located at the busy Nyamasaria market in Kisumu, Kenya. Kisumu is in the lake basin region of Kenya known for the production of fish. 

For the past ten years, George has sold fish and vegetables to the local people. He reports that this business is profitable. His major challenge is the fact that he has no premises to run his business. Nevertheless, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He will be using this loan of Kes 20,000 to pay for his children's school fees. He hopes to expand his business to be able to cater to the needs of her family. In future, he sees himself exporting fillet to other east African companies. He describes himself as God-fearing and quiet.

loans.use: To expand his fish and vegetable vending business

loans.name: Ibroimjon

texts.ru: Каримов Иброимчон проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 42 года. Разведен. Имеет 4 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец и брат находятся в России на заработках. Сам Иброимчон имеет среднее образование. Он более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Ibroimjon K. lives in Fahrhor district. He is 42 years old, divorced with four children. Ibroimjon lives with his parents. His father and brother are currently working in Russia. Ibroimjon has a secondary (high school) education. For over 7 years, he has cultivated plants. He has a plot of land by the house where he plants vegetables and fruit trees. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Furkatdzon

texts.ru: Хушвахтов Фуркатжон проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. В этой области более 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Уже три года как занимает этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Furkatdzon K. lives in Vakhsh district. He is 25 years old and married with two children. He has a secondary (high school) education. Furkatdzhon does construction work on an hourly basis. He has been in this line of work for over 10 years. In addition, he raises livestock on his property, primarily for sale. He has been doing this for three years and is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hotambek

Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.

He has been in this line of business for one year. Homatbek has applied for a loan to purchase more livestock to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 'faithful Women #1 Group

texts.en:
Siah T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Women #1'.  She is 60 years old, married, and has eight children between the ages of 18 and 42 years old. She also cares for five siblings. Siah was not privileged to attend school. 

Siah has been selling charcoal, rice and oil in St. Paul Bridge Community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for 20 years. She plans to use her 20,000 LRD portion of this 95,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal, rice and oil. She describes herself as a friendly woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, rice and oil

loans.name: 'faithful Women #2' Group

texts.en:
Hellen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Women #2'.  She is 50 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 9 and 31 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

Hellen has been selling children's clothes in St. Paul Bridge Community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for 20 years. She plans to use her 15,000 LRD portion of this 75,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of children's clothes to resell. She describes herself as a determined woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lorme is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothes

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Шамсидин житель Вахшского района. Ему 59 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование - высшее, учитель. По профессии проработал 12 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время он занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Shamsiddin A. lives in Vakhsh district. He is 59 and married with four children. He has a higher education and has worked as a teacher for 12 years. In addition he raises livestock in his free time from work. Primarily he raises these animals for sale. He has been doing this for 12 years. Shamsiddin has applied for a loan to purchase additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 'try God' Group

texts.en:
Tete W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Try God'.  She is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children who are between the ages of 16 and 27 years. Due to financial constraints, Tete was only able to attend school through 5th grade. She cares for two siblings.

For 5 years, she has been selling fish in Banjour Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,500 LRD portion of this 37,500 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra es pequeña comerciante desde hace veinte cuatro años, iniciando con poca mercadería, lo que viene aumentar sus ventas atreves de préstamo que Afodenic otorga, lo que vende es prendas de plata, carne, refrescos, gaseosas, en donde ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo para la formación de sus cuatro hijos.
Con sus préstamos ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento pondrá cielo raso y embaldosar parte del patio en la parte de atrás. En donde comprara: arena, cemento, esponjas, láminas de playsem para el cielo raso entre otros para hacer la mejora.
texts.en:
Sandra has been a saleswoman for 24 years. She began with little merchandise, and has seen her sales increase thanks to a loan from Afodenic. She sells silver jewelry, meat, and soft drinks, and has been able to depend on her husband's support while raising their four children.

With her loans, she has made improvements to her house, and with this loan, will put up a ceiling and tile part of the back patio. She plans to buy sand, cement, sponges, and boards as well as other supplies to put up the ceiling.

loans.use: Construction materials for a ceiling and to tile part of the patio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: 'faithful Women #3' Group

texts.en:
Siah G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Women #3'.  She is 55 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 14 to 37 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 18 years, she has been selling slippers and underwear in Duala Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more slippers and underwear to sell.

She describes herself as an honest woman whose dream is to improve her business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and underwear

loans.name: Bismar Antonio

texts.es:
Bismar casado, su esposa es comerciante, tiene un niño pequeño, el cliente considera mejorar la sala de su vivienda, profesión agricultor se le ha presentado problema de falta de financiamientos para salir adelante. Inicio desde muy joven a trabajar la tierra con el apoyo de su suegro. Planes para su negocio es establecer vives en los perímetro de la finca.
 Con el préstamo comprara insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para la aplicarse en la tierra y obtener una mejor cosecha siendo vendida a mejor precio. Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo al desarrollo de su finca.
texts.en:
Bismar is married. His wife is a saleswoman and they have a young son. He wishes to make improvements to his living room. He works in agriculture and has been struggling with the lack of financial capital to get ahead. He began working the land at a very young age with the help of his father in law. He wants to grow crops around the perimeter of his land.

With the loan, he will buy fertilizer for his land to obtain a better crop that will be sold for a better price. He is thankful for the lender for their support of his farm's development.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene la edad de 56 años, padre de tres hijos, que junto a su esposa trabajan para lograr hacer su  casa con mejores condiciones, su esposa trabaja cuidando niños, y su trabajo de Virgilio es como conductor de bus.
Tras largo años de trabajo no había logrado hacer su casa de concreto debido a que tenía que cubrir las necesidades de alimento y estudio de sus hijos, siendo su casa de madera, pues años atrás trabajaba en la agricultura apena ajustaba para los alimentos.  Con sus ahorro comienza a construir de concretos su casa, lo que la tiene bastante construida y que terminara de cerrar con dinero que Afodenic está dando por medio de préstamo, lo que está contento ya que pagara  a plazos, y cerrara su casa. Para un bienestar familia.
texts.en: Virgilio is 56 years old and the father of three children.  He and his wife are both working to improve their home.  His wife works in childcare and he works as a bus driver.  After many years of work he had not been able to put up concrete in their house due to having to pay for the basics of food and school for his children.  His house was made of wood, because many years ago he worked in agriculture and then barely earned enough money for food.  With his savings he began to construct the house of concrete.  The house is now nearly done and he will finish the work with the loan money from Afodenic.  He is happy to be able to pay for this in installments and enclose his home for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Construction materials to finish the concrete work in his home

loans.name: 'united Group'

texts.en:
Maima B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Group'.  She is 57 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 17 and 36 years. She did not attend school. 

For 24 years, she has been selling rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions, etc. in Caldwell Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions, etc. to resell.

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Massa is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions to sell

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Leydi es una mujer trabadora, que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa  con más de seis años en las ventas, iniciando con pocos capital, para lograr apoyar  a su familia. Su esposo es mecánico y junto apoyan  a sus dos pequeños.
Afodenic ha venido a fortalecer su negocio con préstamos que ah dado a plazos, ya que el cincuenta por ciento de sus productos es al crédito con pago de quincena.
Con este nuevo financiamiento  comenzara a construir un cuarto, en donde comprara materiales de construcción para iniciar, y lograr más espacios. Contenta por lograr el objetivo.
texts.en:
Leydi is a hard-working woman who has worked in sales for more than six years selling cosmetics and clothing. She began with little capital but desired to help support her family. Her husband is a mechanic and together they support their two small children.

Afodenic has helped strengthen her business with loans that it provides. Fifty percent of her products are sold on credit and she collects from her clients every other week. She will use this loan to begin construction of a room to have more space and she will use the money to buy construction materials. She is happy to be able to meet her goal.

loans.use: To add on a room in her home

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre que ha trabajado desde muy joven, por su compromiso como papa, siendo padre de tres hijos, casado, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa ya que vende ropa.
Hoy en día trabaja como cadete de taxi, obteniéndolo con ahorros  y apoyo económico de sus hermanos. Luego para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, recurre al financiamiento siendo la opción viable a plazos. Lo que ha sido de gran beneficio para el sustento de su familia.
Con este nuevo préstamo quiere terminar de cerrar el baño, y comprar puerta, para lograr mejor privacidad con su familia en el aseo personal.
texts.en:
Elvis is a man who has worked since he was very young because of his commitment as a father, being the father of three children, and as a married man; his wife helps him by selling clothes.

He works as a Taxi Driver.   He acquired it with his savings and economic help from his siblings.  In order to provide maintenance for his vehicle he relies on loans because of the viability of installment payment; this has been of great benefit for his family’s support.

He wants to use this loan to finish closing off the bathroom and buy a door for it to attain better privacy for his family’s personal hygiene.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to close off the bathroom and attain better privacy for personal hygiene.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Atusparias del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zona urbana marginal que carecen de servicios básicos.

Olga cuenta una mototaxi la cual alquila  a otra persona  para que brinde servicio de transporte público de pasajeros de la ruta Chiclayo – José Leonardo Ortiz y alrededores. Ella tiene tres años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos personales y de su familia.

Olga desea dar mantenimiento a su vehículo de esta manera seguir brindando un buen servicio, además tiene pensado más adelante tener una flota de 5 mototaxis realizando el mismo servicio así podrá incrementar sus ingresos y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the sector of Atusparias in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz. It is one of the most populated districts in the region of Lambayeque, which is characterized by its high rate of poverty and by the people who live on the periphery of the city and lack basic necessities.

Olga relies on her mototaxi which she rents from another person so she can offer public transportation for passengers on the route from Chiclayo to José Leonardo Ortiz and the surrounding areas. She has been doing this work for three years and thanks to this, she is able to pay her personal expenses and those of her family.

Olga wants to maintain her vehicle in order to continue offering good service. She is also thinking of the future when she would like to have a fleet of 5 mototaxis doing the same work in order to increase her income and improve her way of life. She has therefore decided to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
El Sr Donato V. A. es una persona soltera, tiene dos hijos mayores, independientes, el sr. Donato es productor lechero desde hace 30 años, cuando se compró una accion de la pil (planta industrializadora de leche), que es la planta a la que entregan leche los productores que tienen acciones.  Vive en la maica arriba, zona sud de la ciudad, es una zona periférica de la ciudad donde la mayoría de los vecinos se dedica a la producción de leche cruda.

El señor Donato vive  en condiciones muy regulares; con el crédito adquirirá una vaca lechera para reponer dos que se murieron por problemas digestivos que sufrieron  y así volver a equilibrar sus ingresos y salir de la pérdida grande que sufrió de sus vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Mr Donato V. A. is a single man who has two grown children. Donato has been a milk producer for the past 30 years when he bought una accion de la pil (an industrial milk plant), which is the plant that producers who have shares deliver milk. He lives in maica arriba, a zone south of the city. It is an outlying area of city where the majority of the residents work producing raw milk.

Mr. Donato lives in very average conditions. With this loan he will acquire a milk cow to replace two that died from digestive problems, and as a result, rebalance his income from the large loss he suffered from his dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina es una cliente que tiene mucho entusiasmo D. trabajar con nuestra institución "emprender",  ella se siente beneficiada D. gran manera con el préstamo que se le otorga, ella se dedica a  la   venta D. comida se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y poderlos vender a los niños que van al colegio que queda cerca a su vivienda, para ella es un trabajo sacrificado debido a que debe levantar ollas con bastante peso para poder salir a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en la puerta D. su casa. Con los ingresos que percibe mantiene y paga los estudios D. sus  dos hijos  debido a que hace poco tiempo falleció su esposo y quedó viuda. Ahora el crédito lo  destinará  para comprar  una movilidad y hacerla trabajar en el transporte público y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Señora Valentina is a client who has a lot of enthusiasm to work with our institution of entrepreneurship.  She feels greatly benefited by the loan that she is offered.  She is dedicated to the sale of food.  She rises very early to prepare the food and to be able to sell to the children that go to the school that is located close to her dwelling.  For her it is difficult work due to the fact that she must carry heavy pots to her place of business that is located in the door of her house.  With the income that she earns she maintains and pays for the studies of her two children.  A short time ago her husband passed away and left her a widow.  Now, the loan will allow her to buy a car to be able to work in public transportation and thus to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leonidas es un pequeño comerciante que ha venido creciendo gracias a su tenacidad de esfuerzo para lograr apoyar  a su familia, casado, su esposa labora como recepcionista, logrando dar lo necesario a su familia.
Producto de su trabajo por muchos años a la alcaldía con sus ahorros compro un camión, generándole ganancia, lo que luego compra un taxi, para seguir equilibrando sus gastos. 
Afodenic ha sido el medio para dar el mantenimiento  a sus vehículos pues lleva once créditos de los cuales ha sido de mucho beneficio para el desarrollo de su inversión.
Con este nuevo préstamo dará un mantenimiento total del vehículo en la reparación de amortiguador, espejos delantero, caja de transmisión, suspensión entre otro para seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Leónidas is a small merchant who has been growing thanks to his tenacity of effort to support his family.  He’s married and his wife is employed as a Receptionist.  They manage to provide the basics for their family.

His many years work for City Hall made it possible for him to use savings to buy a truck which provided profits he then used to buy a taxi to continue balancing his expenses.

Afodenic has been the means by which he has provided maintenance to his vehicles because he’s had 11 loans that have been of great benefit for the development of his investment.

He will use this new loan to provide total maintenance to the vehicle repairing the shock absorber, front mirror, transmission gear box and suspension, among others to continue providing good service.

loans.use: To repair a shock absorber, front mirror, transmission gear box, suspension and continue providing service.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS UNIDAS” es un grupo que iniciará el onceavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por trece personas, 1 varón y 12 mujeres. Es un grupo muy unido, que le gusta compartir, en la foto aparecen once socias activas, una socia (chaleco café a cuadros)que temporalmente se esta retirando del grupo y no salen en la foto Doña Ines que se encuentra sirviendo la comida y doña Jeannette que se encontraba en el consultorio de salud.

La asociación comunal “AMIGAS UNIDAS” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Lucila, la tesorera la señora  Valeria y como secretario de actas el señor Elias.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.

En el caso de la señora  Valeria,  la tesorera de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio junto con su esposo, el pintado de cabinas (cabezas) de camiones.   El esposo como empleado de una empresa aprendió a pintar autos ahora ambos trabajan en el pintado de cabinas de camion.  Con los primeros créditos pudo comprar soplete, compresora y oxigeno, elementos necesarios para su trabajo.  El crédito de ahora será invertido en la compra de estas cabinas (se trata de la compra de cabinas de segunda mano, que han quedado dañadas por el tiempo o un accidente), para lograr esta compra la señora viaja a ciudades cercanas de la ciudad de El Alto:  Oruro y Cochabamba.  Las ventas son realizadas en el mismo taller.

La señora Valeria,  es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace doce ciclos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “AMIGAS UNIDAS” (United Friends) communal bank is starting its 11th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 13 members; one man and 12 women.  The group is very unified; they like to share.  Eleven active members appear in the photo.  One of the members (in the brown checked vest) is temporarily dropping out of the group and Inés, who is serving food, and Jeannette, who was at the health clinic, don’t appear in the photo.

The “AMIGAS UNIDAS” communal bank set up its governing board thus:  Lucila is President, Valeria is Treasurer and Elias is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the communal bank members are involved in are varied; they have to do with commerce, services and production.

Valeria, communal bank Treasurer, indicates that the business she currently has together with her husband is painting truck cabins.  When her husband was employed at a firm he learned how to pain autos and now they both work painting truck cabins.  She used the initial loans to buy a soldering iron, compressor and oxygen, all necessary elements for the work.  The current loan will be used to buy the cabins (it’s a matter of buying them second hand, the ones that have been damaged by time or by an accident).  To accomplish the purchase she travels to cities near El Alto:  Oruro and Cochabamba.  Sales take place at her workshop.

Valeria is a 30 year old woman living with her husband and three children.  She has collaborated with Pro Mujer for twelve cycles.  When she is asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: To buy second hand truck cabins.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El Sr. ELIAS nacido en Diciembre de 1987, en Villa Barrientos a 5 km de Santa Rita, ahora vive en la localidad de Pacay de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz tiene su propia parcela en la cual trabaja en la agricultura sembrando distintos productos, el es soltero siembra maíz, yuca, maní, frijol y Papa. día se dedica a la agricultura y de noche estudia en la ciudad de Santa Cruz en la universidad estatal donde cursa lo ultimo de su carrera de ingeniería comercial, tiene sus padres que le apoyan con su trabajo. Con el dinero del crédito comprara mas semillas para la siembra de Papa ya que es temporada de siembra, después de cosecharlo lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona y así poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, uno de sus deseos es el de terminar sus estudios y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es un joven responsable y trabajador con ganas de superación, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la Confianza Brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Elias was born in December, 1987, in Villa Barrientos, 5 kilometers from Santa Rita.  He now lives in Santa Cruz’s Pacay section and has his own parcel of land on which he farms various products like corn, manioc, peanuts, beans and potatoes.  He’s single.

During the day he farms and in the evening he’s going to the state university in the city of Santa Cruz where he’s finishing up his Commercial Engineering degree.  His parents support his efforts.

He will use the money to increase his working capital from the loan to buy more potato seeds since this is planting season; once harvested he sells it in the local market.  

One of his wishes is to finish his schooling to improve his quality of life.  He’s a responsible, hard working young man with a drive to self improvement.  He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

loans.use: For his potato crops.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS” es un grupo que iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho personas, 1 varón y 7 mujeres.

La asociación comunal “AMAPOLAS” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Eva Ema, la tesorera la señora  Catalina y como secretaria de actas la señora Celia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción. Entre ellos tenemos: pensión, comerciante de comida, carpintería, ferretería, venta de cocinas, tejido de chompas de alpaca, venta de cosméticos.

En el caso de la señora  Eva,  la presidenta de la asociación comunal “Amapolas”, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio la atención de una Pensión.  Este negocio tiene dos años de existencia, antes vendía en un puesto en la ciudad de La Paz.   Cambio de negocio por que pienso que sus hijos necesitaban más de su atención, en  particular su hija quinceañera (la menor), por eso inició este negocio mucho más cerca de su domicilio. Su crédito anterior fue invertido en la compra de víveres, el crédito que ha solicitado ahora será invertido en la compra de cocinas, las que necesita renovar, el saldo le servirá para comprar víveres.

La señora Eva  es una mujer que  vive con  sus tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer, el hijo mayor ya se encuentra casado y vive en otra casa, la señora Eva se encuentra orgullosa de sus hijos por que ella sola ha podido satisfacer todas las necesidades del hogar, y lograr que ellos estudien y sean personas de bien. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace dos ciclos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  es compartir con sus compañeras. En la foto se presentan nueve señoras, pues la mamá de una de ellas estuvo presente, llevaba un bebé en los brazos.
texts.en:
The “AMAPOLAS” (Poppies) communal bank is starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members: one man and 7 women.

The “AMAPOLAS” communal bank set up its governing board thus:  Eva Ema is President, Catalina is Treasurer and Celia is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the members are involved in are varied.  They have to do with commerce, services and production.  Among them we have: daily meals, food sales, carpentry, hardware store, kitchenware sales, alpaca sweater weaving and cosmetics sales.

Eva, “Amapolas” communal bank President tells us that she’s currently running a daily meals preparation business.  It’s been in existence two years.  She used to sell in a stand in the city of La Paz.  She changed business because she felt her children needed more of her attention, in particular her fifteen-year-old (the youngest).  This is why she started this business much closer to home.  She used the prior loan to buy foodstuffs.  The loan she’s requested now will be used to buy kitchen equipment, which she needs to renovate; any remainder will be used to buy food.

Eva is a woman living with her three children: two boys and one girl.  Her oldest son is married and lives in another house.  Eva is proud of her children because she has supported them by herself and has provided them with education so that they have become upstanding citizens.  She has worked with Pro Mujer for two cycles.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes to share with her fellow members.  

In the photo there are nine women because the mother of one of the members attended; she’s carrying an infant in her arms.

loans.use: To buy a kitchen equipment (to renew it) and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora vive por la Zona de Viloma Grande, a 25 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona de Sipe Sipe, ella se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda y a la agricultura, cultivando de cebolla, zanahoria y maiz. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños. de 12, 7 y 5 años, que asisten a la escuela, en la misma zona. Su concubino la abandono hace tres años. Ahora  viven solos en su casa y Dora siempre a buscado la forma de sustentar su hogar; ahora trabaja dentro del proyeto que trabaja con el embolsado de plantas, han creado un nuevo proyecto que les ayudara, este proyecto consiste en la cria y engorde de conejos, este proyecto les construira la granja y los afiliados deberan comprar los conejos, para esta inversion es por la que se apersono la Sra Dora porque ella conoce de este negocio y sabe que le rendira muy buenos resultados.

Con esta actividad mas la sra. Dora podra generar mas ingresos para su familia, esta señora es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora con el tiempo lograra todos sus sueños, que sus hijo terminen el colegio y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Dora lives in the Viloma Grande zone, which is 25 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba in the Sipe Sipe municipality.  She devotes herself to producing raw milk and to farming.  She grows onions, carrots, and corn.  She has three young children, ages 12, 7, and 5.  They go to school in the zone where they live.  Her common-law husband left her three years ago.

Now they live alone in her house.  Dora has always looked for the way to support her household.  She now works on a project that works with packaging plants.  They have created a new project, which will help them.  This project consists of raising and fattening rabbits.  This project will build the farm, and the affiliates need to buy the rabbits.

This investment is why Dora came to us.  She knows about this business, and she knows that it will give her very good results.  With this additional business activity Dora will be able to generate more income for her family.  She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman.  In time she will achieve all of her dreams, which are that her children finish school and become successful people.

loans.use: Capital to invest in a rabbit farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy her merchandise in batches

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
Maria C. hace 14 años inicio su negocio  de bazar y lo mantiene hasta ahora, además imparte clases de ingles para principiantes, intermedias y avanzadas.

El trabajo lo realiza con una chica a la  cual le ayuda hasta el medio día de 8:30 hasta 7:00pm 
Unos de sus obstáculos es la delincuencia lo cual hace deficiente su trabajo ya que esta cerca del cementerio del batallón. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos. Unas de sus metas es el crecimiento de su negocio  junto a las clases de  ingles que diariamente lo realiza.
texts.en:
Maria C. set up her store 14 years ago and still has it today, in addition she teaches English classes for beginners, intermediate and advanced.

She works from 8:30 to 7:00pm and has a girl to help her until midday.
One of her obstacles is crime which makes her work difficult as it is near the batallón cemetary. 

With this loan she is going to buy exercise books, pencils, pens. One of her goals is the growth of her business together with the English classes she takes daily.

loans.use: Exercise books, stationery

loans.name: Armida Zuleyma

texts.es:
Armida, D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. Frutas, verduras, tostadas D. plátano y yuca.
El negocio D. ella es ofrecer frutas D. temporada, verduras, su hija D. 16 años le ayuda a vender por las calles D. la ciudad, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para afinar el piso D. la vivienda y otra parte invertirlo en el negocio, específicamente en frutas, yuca y plátanos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar no solo con la vivienda sino también en el negocio. 
Los sueños D. Armida es en un futuro contar con una vivienda más bonita, en mejores condiciones, ampliarla con un cuarto, también quiere que su hija tenga un futuro diferente, que estudie y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Armida, 34, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She sells fruit, vegetables and fried bananas and manioc.  Her business consists in selling seasonal fruit and vegetables.  Her 16-year-old daughter helps her sell throughout the city streets.  

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve the floor in her house and part of it to invest in the business, specifically in fruit, manioc and bananas.  This investment will help her improve not only her house but also her business.

Armida’s dream for the future is to have a prettier house; one in better condition, enlarged with the addition of a bedroom.  She also wants her daughter to have a different future; that she study so that she can improve herself.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to repair the floor in her house.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María A. empezó vendiendo frutas hace 10 años atrás luego fue incrementando poco a poco su tienda y la motivo la necesidad de un ingreso economico estable. En la actualidad vende en su tienda arroz, azúcar aceite. 

Trabaja con sus 2 hijos todos los días de 6am  a 10pm. Unas de sus inconvenientes es el dengue enfermedad estacional poca salubridad en el barrio. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar, abastos. Unas de sus metas es incrementar su negocio arreglar su casa y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
María A. started selling fruits 10 years ago and then expanded her store little by little. Her main motivation for doing this was her need for a stable income. She currently sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. in her store.

She works with her two children every day from 6am to 10pm. One of the problems is dengue fever, a seasonal disease, in the neighborhood. With the loan, she will buy rice, sugar, and supplies. Some of her goals are to expand her business, fix her house, and for her children to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, supplies

loans.name: Mañanitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Mañanitas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, joviales, risueñas y con mucho deseo de auto superarse  una de ellas es la señora Walkiria F. de 41 años inicio su negocio hace ocho años con un pequeño canasto de truchas como prensapelos, pirañas, colas, pulseras, aros etc. en la actualidad ella comercializa adornos, juguetes, relojes, retrateras entre otros productos.
 Ella tiene cinco hijos de 22, 21, 19, 17 y 15 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio. F. con el crédito piensa aumentar su negocio y poner una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
Las otras integrantes son Darling de los Ángeles L. Carranza quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 8 años y Gloria de los Ángeles Gonzales Osorio se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado..
texts.en:
The Mañanitas group consists of three hard-working, cheerful, smiling people, who have a strong desire to achieve.  One of these is Mrs. Walkiria F., 41 years old, who started her business eight years ago with a small basket of articles such as hair clips, combs, bracelets, earrings, etc.  At present she sells ornaments, toys, watches, picture frames, and other goods.
She has five children, 22, 21, 19, 17, and 15 years old, who help with her business.  With the loan, F. plans to expand her business and set up a “fritanga,” or casual restaurant offering fried food.
The other members are Darling de los Ángeles L. Carranza (who has been in the shoe business for 8 years), and Gloria de los Ángeles Gonzales Osorio, who is in the clothing and shoe business.

loans.use: For products and to set up a fried-foods restaurant

loans.name: Marisela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marisela A. realiza su trabajo desde hace 2 años  comenzó vendiendo interiores, ahora vende ropa en los pueblos los sábados y domingos. Su esposo la ayuda viajando hasta los lugares (Salitre, Yaguachi, Milagro etc.)
Unas de sus inconvenientes por ahora es el invierno ya que llueve mucho y los lugares donde vende su mercadería están inaccesibles llegar.

Con el préstamo  va a comprar ropa, pantalones, camisas y interiores. Unas de sus metas es obtener una cartera de clientes de unos  50 y entregar su mercadería hasta los días (jueves y viernes) en los pueblos.
texts.en:
Marisela A. has been working for two years; she started out selling underwear.  Now she sells clothes in the towns on Saturdays and Sundays.  Her husband helps her travel to the places (Salitre, Yaguachi, Milagro, etc.)

One of the current inconveniences she’s facing is winter; it rains much and the places she visits to sell her merchandise are inaccessible.

She will use the loan to buy clothes: pants, shirts and underwear.  One of her goals is to have a regular base of about 50 customers and to sell her wares in the towns on Thursdays and Fridays too.

loans.use: For pants, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia, una joven de 25 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 meses, vive con sus padres y un hermano, residen en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán. Claudia se dedica a la venta de tamales, pupusas y tortillas, generalmente  los tamales los vende los viernes y el fin de semana,  los demás días vende las pupusas y tortillas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar los ingredientes y preparar las pupusas, tamales, maíz y leña, esta inversión le ayudara a tener suficiente material para aumentar la producción y ofrecer a los clientes.
El propósito de Claudia es tener un negocio fuerte, estable que le ayude a cubrir las necesidades de ella, su hija y su familia
texts.en:
Claudia, a young 25-year-old woman, is the single mother of a 3 month old daughter and lives with her parents and a brother in El Divisadero department of Morazan.  Claudia is dedicated to the sale of tamales, tortillas, and pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  Generally she sells tamales Fridays and on weekends.  The remaining days, she sells tortillas and pupusas.

Claudia is soliciting a loan to buy the ingredients to prepare pupusas, tamales, corn and firewood.  This investment will help her to have sufficient materials to augment production to offer her customers.

Claudia's proposal is to have a strong business, stable enough to help her to cover her necessities and those of her daughter and family.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS TO PREPARE POPULAR SALVADORAN FOOD FOR SALE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a griddle to make pupusas (thick cornmeal stuffed with cheese, pork, or beans)

loans.name: Los Dávila Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Dávila está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Meyling Francisca Dávila Rojas quien se dedica al comercio de frutas al inicio hace ocho años aproximadamente empezó comprando los productos por libras en la actualidad compra las cosechas de tamarindo, mango, jocote y mamón.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años y una bebe de cuatro meses por los cuales labora arduamente junto a su esposo y suegro. Dávila con el crédito comprara cosecha de jocote y mamón.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Modesta  Francisca J. de 19 años quien vende tamarindo, jocote y mamón y Milagro de Jesús Dávila quien comercializa frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The los Dávila group has three hardworking and entrepreneurial members. One of them is Meyling Francisca Dávila Rojas who sells fruit. Eight years ago, she started buy products by the pound. Now she is buying tamarind, mango, jocote and papaya.
She has three children-a ten year old, a five year old and four month old baby. They are reason she works hard along with her husband and father-in-law. Dávila will buy jocote and papaya with the loan. 
The other members of the group are 19 year old Modesta Francisca J. who sells tamarind, jocote and papaya and Milagro de Jesús Dávila who sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy jocote and papaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sand, cement and iron rods.

loans.name: Deymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Deymi lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, joviales y emprendedoras una de ellas es Kennys  Ocarina Norori de 23 años hace tres años inicio vendiendo tortas de papa y poco a poco fue aumentando y diversificando su negocio en la actualidad tiene una comideria, vende fresco y una pequeña venta.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años quienes son su inspiración y sueña en tener una gran pulpería.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Demi B. de 22 años vende frijoles cocidos hace 5 años y tiene una pequeña venta la cual sueña en tener una micelania, Ana Pavón Norori vende ropa y plata su meta a corto plazo es tener una vitrina en su casa surtida y Aracely N. B. vende verduras y frutas negocio que espera ver crecer.
texts.en:
The Deymi group is comprised of three hard-working, jovial, and enterprising women.  Kennys Ocarina Norori, age 23, is one of them.  Three years ago she started selling potato cakes.  Little by little she was expanding and diversifying her business.  Now she has an eatery, sells soft drinks, and has a small sales business.

She has three children; ages 7, 4, and 3; and they are her inspiration.  She dreams of having a big grocery store.

Another member of the group, 22 year old Demi B., has been selling cooked beans for five years.  She has a small sales business, and she dreams of having a general store.  Ana Pavón Norori, also a member, sells clothes and silver.  Her short term goal is to have a display case in her stocked house.  The other member, Aracely N. B., sells fruits and vegetables.  She hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellos es Damaso Abba V. Gago, él  junto a sus 5 hijos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años en especial maíz, frijoles, trigo etc. Con el préstamo el paga el alquiler de las tierras donde cultiva.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Xiomara H. quien vende chatarra desde hace 2 años y María Luisa M. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Primero Dios ["God First"] group is made up of three hard-working people. One of them is Damaso Abba V. Gago, who has worked in agriculture for the past 6 years together with his 5 children, especially growing corn, beans, wheat, etc. With the loan, he will pay the rent for the lands he cultivates. 

The other members of the group are Xiomara H., who has sold scrap metal for 2 years, and María Luisa M., who sells clothing.

loans.use: Paying the rent for his farmland

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora Magda Auxiliadora A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene un pequeño caramanchel donde vende de todo un poco desde hace 10 años dijo mientras se sonrojaba. Ella comercializa arroz, azúcar, dulces, chiverías (meneíto, tortillitas, galletas, tortas, fresquito etc.) etc. 
Esta señora de 63 años es viuda y tiene tres hijos los cuales son mayores.
texts.en: Mrs. Magda Auxiliadora A. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  She blushingly told us that she has a small lean-to where she has sold a bit of everything for 10 years.  She sells rice, sugar, candy, snacks (corn puffs, tortilla chips, cookies, cakes, frozen treats, etc.)  She is 63 years old, widowed and has three adult children.

loans.use: In products like basic grains and snacks.

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es:
La señora Yasmina Elida L. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria de Masaya Ciudad de las Flores. Ella inicio con una silla, espejo, tijera y unos cuantos productos su pequeño salón de belleza  el cual poco a poco fue aumentando además de invertir en el comercio de ropa.
L. trabaja junto con su hermana e invertirá el creditro en cosméticos y ropa y su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a su hijo que sea un profesional.
texts.en: Yasmina Elida Lopez, a female worker, is a courageous and enterprising native of Masaya, "the City of Flowers."  She started her small beauty salon with a chair, mirror, scissors and a few products.  Her business gradually grew and she began investing in the clothing business.  Yasmina works with her sister and plans to spend loan proceeds on cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is to raise her son to be a professional.

loans.use: Cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El señor Roger Antonio B. es trabajador, esforzado, emprendedor y con grandes metas en primero es tener su casa y un carro. Él tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace 5 años la cual inicio vendiendo chiverías meneíto, platanito, fresquito, boli, tortillitas, palitos…etc. 
B. junto con su esposa trabajan arduamente en su negocio e invertirá el crédito en productos en especial granos básicos y maíz para la tortillería que tiene.
texts.en: Roger Antonio B. is a hard worker, dedicated, and enterprising, with big dreams, the first being to have his own home and a car. He has had a small local store for five years. He started by selling sweets, ice cream, bananas, fresquito (a gelatin-based dessert), boli (frozen fruit dessert, similar to a popsicle), lollipops and tortillas. Nowadays, B. and his wife both work very hard in their business and will invest the loan in products such as staple grains and corn for the tortillas they make.

loans.use: Staple grains and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install concrete flooring.

loans.name: Gabi Maria

texts.es:
Gabi C. tiene varios años con su tienda ya que comenzó alquilando un local por su casa y ahora se cambio a su casa y modifico la sala  y  ahorra el costo de alquiler. Gabi con la tienda que vende arroz, azúcar, legumbres ayuda a su hermana y a su mama pero ella es la que atiende todo el día el local.
