loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Abel  Mwamuye

texts.en:
Abel Mwamuye M. is a 34-year-old man. He is married to Bendera and they have been blessed with five children.

Abel has been working in the quarry for the past year. This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to lease a plot of land to do quarry work so that he can meet the demand of his customers.  

The anticipated profits will be directed into the construction of a permanent house for his family. He hopes to buy a stone cutter to finish the project, as this will ease his work.

loans.use: To lease land to quarry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Anitha T., who is in her early thirties, is married with three children.  She has been running a second-hand sales business for 9 years.  She works from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anitha's 1st "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A "motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes for a loan to expand her business stock.  Her dream is to open a shop selling food.

Anitha will share this loan with her loan group "Mwamko", which has a total of 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Anitha is first on the left.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., age 54, is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Tom, a good territory for farming. He is a married man who is devoted to his three married children – two of whom are working in a variety of occupations to earn their daily income. 

Mao C. owns a big farm that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows various crops on it. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. 

Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mao C.’s business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crops.   Sok Pom is taking out this loan to purchase a machine to pump water for his crops. He hopes to use the remainder of funds to grow a soy bean crop. 

Mao C. and his wife are pictured on the photo.

loans.use: To purchase water pump and grows a soy bean crop

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia C. is from the village of Marcos. She is 50 years old. Sonia is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Sonia C.".

Sonia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sonia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Sonia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 34 years old and lives with her parents and son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a rented two-room house. One room is used as a food shop on a busy street in town. Her parents are retired and her son goes to a local secondary school. She began operating her food shop in 2009. 

Although she pays 100,000 MNT for the shop's rent, her income is good enough to support the family.  She was able to buy a car with the money she earned from her business in 2011. She wants to expand her business and have her own store so that she can save money on rent. She is a hard-working and modest person who says, "I am trying to make more profit and save money to have my own shop as well as for my son's future education." 

Dolgorsuren is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase flour, rice and a variety of other foods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, etc. to sell in her shop

loans.name: Neeang

texts.en:
Neeang N. is a 35-year-old rice farmer who lives in the province Kompong Tom. She is married to Kong Cheurn, age 44. The couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to five children who are still single  –  two of them are employed in different jobs to earn income. 

Neeang N. would like to request a loan to invest in her farming business by planting a soy bean crop.

loans.use: To plant soy bean crop

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa, 41, is married and lives with her husband and three sons in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a plot of land that they own, on the outskirts of the city. Her husband works as a plumber and her two older sons work for a construction business while the youngest son attends a local secondary school. 

Tsevelmaa began selling vegetables and groceries in 2004. Now she rents a stall in one of the busiest trading centers of the city.  Recently her business has become more stable. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "We want to finish our house which is being built at the moment. I am planning to expand my business in order to make more profit." She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more vegetables and groceries for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and groceries

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 39 years old.  She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 15.  She also cares for 5 dependents, who are her relatives.  

Marie Chantal has a spacious shop selling charcoal, which she has been running for 1 year.   Currently she has 2 employees and her shop is open 7 days a week.

Marie Chantal plans to use her loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  Any profits will be used to buy clothing for the children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edgar's Group

texts.en:
Edgar D. is from the village of Dummon. He is 36 years old. Edgar is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Edgar D.".

Edgar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Edgar owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edgar has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Edgar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Edgar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary O. is a 49-year-old lady from Pap Onditi, just a few kilometres from Kisumu city.  She is married to James and they have four children between the ages of 24 and 18.

Rosemary is a tailor and has been in this business for the past eight years.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a client who has benefited from the loans.  

Rosemary will use the entire loan amount to buy materials to add to her stock to enable her to serve her clients well. Her monthly income is KES. 13,000 and she is optimistic that this will increase after getting the loan.

Her dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit A. was born in 1978. He lives in Kapan with his parents, his wife, and his two sons. Davit’s elder son is 7 years old and his younger son is 5 years old. Davit’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. 

Davit works as a driver at a telephone company and at the same time he keeps poultry and sells agricultural produce. Thanks to his various activities over the last few years, Davit was able to buy a van, which he uses to haul chicken feed and agricultural produce from villages to the town of Kapan. 

This is Davit’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a $1,900 to buy chicken feed and a new sort of chickens for his farm. He intends to spend part of his loan repairing his van.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and a new sort of chickens for his farm and repair his van

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish vending businesses.  She lives in Daan Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,500. Aida is borrowing PHP 13,000 to purchase fishing gear and equipment.  This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cassava flour

loans.name: Gladys Kahaso

texts.en: Gladys Kahaso K., a 46-year-old fish monger who has been in business for the last two years, is married to Morris and they have two children. This being her second loan from KADET LTD., Gladys plans to purchase more fish to sell, and the anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady who is able to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ramu Mitavu

texts.en:
Ramu, who is 45 years old and married to a lawyer, has nine children between the ages of 1 and 25 years old. Ramu contributes to the family by selling jerry cans, a well-organised business that is open daily from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has been operating her enterprise for two years.

Ramu will use her loan to purchase more jerry cans to sell to business people. She will reinvest any additional profit that she makes into her business, which will ultimately help her to better provide for her large family.

loans.use: To purchase more jerry cans to sell

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nansalmaa is a 36-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two boys attend a secondary school. Since 2003, Mrs. Nansalmaa has been running a sports shoes retail business. She rents a stall on Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Every month she travels to China to buy her products for sale. She is a hardworking woman who is left to raise her two children on her own. Her dream is to raise her kids healthy and to have a proper family house in the future. Now spring time is approaching and therefore she is planning to increase her income by extending her stall and inventory by buying more sport shoes.

loans.use: To buy more sport shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying meat, cold drinks, clothes, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy material for making mats

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a 47-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes/pants and fish vending.  She lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu. Anselma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anselma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy fish & stocks of clothes/pants to sell so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Anselma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old divorced man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He works in the Lebanese army. At the same time, he decided to open a small bakery in 2010. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. In Lebanon, it’s very common to have multiple jobs to be able to handle the heavy living expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to develop his bakery and expand his productivity by increasing his inventory. In the long term, he is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his operation by opening a restaurant on the same lot where his bakery is located.

loans.use: to develop his bakery and expand his productivity by increasing his inventory

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.ru:
Chingiz G. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoromu 4 qoda. Chingiz jivet v qorode Baku vmeste s lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Chingiz uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji suxofruktov , orexi i t.d.
On pokupayet orexi v optavuyu, a frukti on visushivayet sam doma, yemu v etom pomoqayet yeqo jena, posle cheqo on prodoyot ix v etom magazine. 
Seychas Chingiz nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti dlya visushki , takje on xochet kupi qrecskiye orexi , fishtashki i t.d dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Chingiz G. is 29 years old.  He is married and has one child, who is 4 years old.  Chingiz lives in the city of Baku together with his beloved wife and child.  Chingiz has been involved in the business of selling dried fruits, nuts and such for 5 years.  He buys nuts wholesale and dries fruits at home.  His wife helps him with this business.  Chingiz then sells nuts and fruits at his store.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy fruits for drying.  He also wants to buy walnuts, pistachios, etc. for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of products for future resale

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung N. has been spending her life cultivating crops in the province of Battambong. She learned how to grow rice crops from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children, two of whom are single and the other two are married and have their own houses. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Besides farming, Ung N. sells a few products next to her house; products such as cooking ingredients, fast food, shampoo, and other necessary items. This family earns an income of about 6 USD each day to support all the family's expenses. In order to make additional profit, Ung N. would like to apply for a loan to buy essential items for selling.

loans.use: To increase inventory in general store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing of products.

She has operated a natural tiens Tianshi medicine selling business (traditional Chinese medicine) for over a year, selling in a shop to her local neighbors. Margaret faces a major challenge of competition from other tiens products sellers in the area. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase natural tiens Tianshi medicine products to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase natural tiens Tianshi medicine products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and brothers. He is from Lebanon. He started to work in the mechanics field at a very young age. This talented young man opened his own car repair shop and started to offer his clients good-quality services. This resulted in his getting a large number of customers among those passing by his garage.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. mechanic's tools in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. He is very positive about his future plans. His income is needed to help support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mechanic's tools

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Сангова Баргигул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Ее сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Сама Баргигул имеет среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она в основном берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки материалов, чтобы сшить детские платья для продажи.
texts.en: Bargigul S. lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 50 years old, married and has 6 children.  Her sons are working in Russia.  Bargigul has a secondary education.  She is involved in sewing national dresses and primarily completes her orders at home.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials in order to make children's dresses for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman who lives in Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a grocery store, a livestock business and buying and selling gasoline. Her husband Roel, who is 48 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 10 and 16 years old. Antonieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for future improvement in her business. Antonieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Hoeun K. is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She owns a small shop in the local market where she sells food, plastic products, and other items for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically earns $3 a day, which is used to meet her family's needs. Her husband is a taxi driver around the village in Battambong province. Presently, his motorbike is broken. Hoeun K. does not have enough money to help her husband purchase a new one. Therefore, she is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a secondhand motorbike to replace the broken one. With this loan, her husband can continue with his motor taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sagia

texts.en:
Sagia is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 26 years old, married to a soldier, with two children. Neither of them goes to school. Sagia took out a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.

In the future, Sagia hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Firuzamo

texts.ru: Тешаева Фирузамо жительница города Куляб. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Работает на рынке Саховат. Она в основном занимается продажей женских платьев и парфюмерий. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Firuzamo T. lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education and works at the Sahovat market.  Firuzamo primarily sells women's dresses and perfumery.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He has been working as a taxi driver for 5 years.  His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. And he also does private transportation upon request of the clients. He has obtained two Kiva loans and was a very good client.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to make much needed repairs to his taxi, including improving the shuttle’s body and updating the paint. He says that he will be able to attract new customers to his business after making these repairs. His income from his taxi business is vital to his family. In the future, he is hoping to purchase a new van so that he can continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to make much needed repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is currently in the business of selling buns and alcohol. She is 28 years old, married, with one child who does not go to school. Joyce took out a loan to stock more buns and alcohol to sell. In the future, Joyce hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more buns and alcohol to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is 35 and the mother of five kids who currently live with her in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for five years. She also relies on income from her husband who has a formal salary every month. Recently, this family is not comfortable with living in their house because it needs to be repaired so Chea S. has decided to ask for a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her broken house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more machine oil and motor oil

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with one pre-school child. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Loice faces a major challenge in late payment by those who purchase in credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bundle of materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance car trader and broker for 6 years.  He helps his father to support the family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with on-time payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on the cars before selling them so that he can guarantee his clients that they will purchase a safe car with top quality, inside and outside. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business and open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on cars he will sell

loans.name: Djavad

texts.ru:
Djavad M. 28 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Djavad uje 7 let kak jivet v Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Djavid ranshe rabotal prodavcom v druqom magazine no teper u neqo svoy magazin uje kak 6 let on zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji ovoshey i fruktov. 
Seychas Djavad nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chotbi rasshirit pomesheniye magazina i uvelichit kolichestvo polok dlya ovoshey i fruktov.
texts.en: Djavad M. is 28 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Djavad has been living in Baku together with his parents for 7 years.  He previously worked as a salesperson at another store, but now has his own store, where he has been involved in selling vegetables and fruits for 6 years.  Currently, Djavad needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his store space and increase the number of shelves for vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Mississo

texts.fr: Agé de  48 ans, Monsieur  Mississo  est marié et a  2 enfants. Il exerce  comme  activité  l’extraction et la vente  de  vin  de  palme. Il s’approvisionne  dans les  palmerais et a commencé son  activité  en  2007. Il  a employé   4 personnes qui l’aident  dans  cette  activité. Il  sollicite un  prêt  pour acheter 20  palmiers.
texts.en: Mr. Mississo is a 48-year-old married man with two children. In 2007, he started extracting and selling palm wine. He gets his stocks in palm groves. He has four employees to help him in this activity. He is seeking a loan to purchase 20 palm trees.

loans.use: To buy palm trees

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a open retail shop for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Shida faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase four bundles of tea leaves and sacks of sugar to resell in smaller amounts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other essential supplies

loans.name: Dossi  Abla

texts.fr: Madame Abla est mariée et a  2 enfants. Elle habite quartier  Kpogan.  Pour  participer  au    menage,  elle  fait la  vente  de pagnes  et  casseroles.  Elle a  commencé  en  2006 et s’approvisionne en  gros  au  grand  marché de  Lomé.  Ensuite,  elle  redistribue  en détail.   Elle  sollicite de Wages  un  prêt  pour  se  réapprovisionner  et satisfaire   plus  de  clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Abla is married with two children. She lives in the Kpogan neighborhood. In order to help with the household responsibilities, she started selling pots and pagnes (colorful print cloth) in 2006. She gets her merchandise wholesale at the grand market of Lomé for resale at retail. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to replenish her stocks and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy pots and pagnes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair their taxi

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.ru:
Sadagat H. zamujem i imeyet 2 detey . Sadagat yavlyayestay IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. 
Ona uje 3 qoda kak zanimayestay etim biznessom prodaji posudi. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye posudi dlya prodaji. Ona imeyet mnoqo pokupateley sredi svoix sosedey. Sadagat ranshe rabotala prodavshiccey v produktovom magazine.
texts.en: Sadagat H. is married and has 2 children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the city of Baku together with her beloved family.  Sadagat has been involved in the business of selling dishware for 3 years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy dishware for sale.  She has many customers among her neighbors.  Sadagat previously worked as a salesperson at a food market.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood for a bakery

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaisha has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business for the past two years. Her local neighbours are potential customers. Her major challenge is seasonality. She hopes to purchase a matatu (van/small bus) in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle for her transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to sell

loans.name: Saidmurtazo

texts.ru: Сафоев Саидмуртазо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Саидмуртазо имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. Он предоставляет услугу, занимается перевозкой. У него имеется трактор и грузовой автомобиль. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Saidmurtazo S. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saidmurtazo has a secondary-specialized education as a driver.  He provides a transportation service.  He has a tractor and a heavy-duty truck.  Saidmurtazo has a lot of experience in this business.  He is requesting this loan for car repairs.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Rashad

texts.ru:
Rashad H. 27 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi rodelyami i bratom. 6 let tomu nazad Rashad otkril magazin qde nachal prodovat instrumeni , elektriku i t.d. Etomu biznesssu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy i pomoq yemu otkrit etot magazin. 
Seychas Rashad nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovar dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Rashad H. is 27 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He lives in the city of Baku together with his parents and brother.  Six years ago, Rashad opened a store, where he started selling tools, electric equipment, etc.  He learned this business from his father, who helped him open this store.  Currently, Rashad needs 2000 AZN in order to buy merchandise for sale and to develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other materials for a sewing business.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
For the past 14 years, Mastura has made a living selling accessories and office supplies in her store. She is married, has four children and is determined to provide a better living for family. She is hard working and kind, and is committed to her business and providing outstanding service. She is skilled at what she does and has a perfect credit history with IMON International. Mastura has applied for a loan for $1,500 to buy the equipment she needs to expand her business and improve the financial situation of her family.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand a small store

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
A. Sabohat is 44 years old and lives at home with her husband and children. She works hard in her shop in the central market of Gafurov, where she sells fabrics in order to earn enough money to educate her children through the university level. She has done a great job of expanding her business, which began with little inventory in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. She has applied for a loan of 6,000 Somoni so that she can buy a greater variety of fabrics and fulfill a few specific requests from her customers. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bisalomat

texts.en:
K. Bisalomat is an enterprising business owner who lives in Gafurov, Tajikistan. She makes a living selling fabrics in a very attractive store located in her town's central market. She has been in business for 15 years, is married and has three children. She has applied for a loan for 6,000 Somoni to buy an assortment of fabrics she will use to sew national dresses for her customers. She hopes to continue making a good profit and earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to use in making dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase onions, maize, potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a thirty-one-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda with an ambition of educating his children up to university. He has been dealing in phone accessories for three years and the business is still booming. He has challenges of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. Lawrence needs the loan to buy phones for resale.

loans.use: Buying phones for resale

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
Abdukarim is married and has two children. He has a small store where he sells fabrics used for sewing national dresses. The business is located in a famous central market of Gafurov. Abdukarim has been in this business for 10 years already. He runs it with his mother, who encouraged him to start this business and is very supportive even now. 

Abdukarim is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase more goods. This business has its high season very soon. Abdukarim believes that opening second retail outlet will give him an advantage over his competitors and provide his family with more profit in the coming spring season.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for resale

loans.name: Idibek

texts.en:
S. Idibek is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. For almost 10 years, Idibek has been working as a market vendor. He sells plates and dishes of the oriental style. This kind of the goods is in popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for girls' dowries and also for family celebrations. 

His love for his children is the biggest reason for Idibek to make an effort to provide what they need. Now Idibek is planning to enlarge the range of goods and to purchase more china to expand his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he requests 12,000 Somoni. The well-being of Idibek’s family and his business are in your hands. Idibek and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes in oriental style

loans.name: Rasiya

texts.en:
Rasiya E. is 51, married, and has two children. Rasiya works as a librarian in the local administration of  Keper-Arik village, and her husband, Shukurbek, is a stockkeeper/clerk.  In order to add to their income, Rasiya’s family is engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity with initial capital of 10,000 KGS, and now they have a farm with one milk cow, one horse, twenty sheep and bull calves. Also, Rasiya is engaged in cultivating the land  with sugar beets, a profitable activity. 

Rasiya has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle, which will allow her to increase milk product sales. With the revenues, she plans to hold her son’s marriage and give a good dowry for her daughter. Rasiya’s family is very tight-knit and makes every effort to make their dreams of a prosperous future come true. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Латипов Бозор проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он женат, имеет 6 детей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Сам Бозор имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. По специальности работает 10 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Bozor L. lives in the Kulob Region. He is 50 years old. He is married, with six children. His children temporarily work in Russia. Bozor has secondary specialized education; he is a driver. He has been exercising this profession for 10 years. In addition, in his free time he does farming. He has a land plot near his house, where he grows wheat and plants fruit trees. He has been doing this for over 7 years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase seeds.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds

loans.name: Spartin

texts.en: Spartin M. lives with his wife and two children in one of the villages of Syunik region which is famous for its severe cold climate. The best agricultural businesses for the locals are cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. Spartin is planning for the spring – to seed a particular grass to have cattle fodder. He also needs some gasoline in order to transport the grass and cattle once the busy season starts.

loans.use: seeds and gasoline

loans.name: Jumaa Kitsao

texts.en:
Jumaa Kitsao K. is a 26-year old man from Mariakani. He is married to Amina, and they have two children.  He has been selling Safaricom modem cards and cigarettes for the last four years in Mariakani, and has earned a good income. 

He has not taken out any loan prior to this first loan from KADET LTD.  With it, he plans to purchase more cards and cigarettes. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business. 

Jumaa hopes to grow his business and in the future be able to supply the cards at wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more modem cards and cigarettes for his business

loans.name: Missewou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Missewou  a  36 ans et marié.  IL a 2 enfants  à   charge. Il exerce  comme métier   la fabrication et la vente des  chaussures et  sacs.  Il  s’approvisionne  au  Niger,  au Mali et à Lomé la capitale du  Togo.  Il  a commencé  en  1995 son activité  et  revend  les  marchandises  sur 103 Rue, Wahala.  Il demande  un prêt  pour   acheter  50  cuirs  et  5  boîtes de  colle.
texts.en: Mr. Missewou is 36 years old. He is married and has two dependent children. His profession is making shoes and bags for sale. He stocks up in Niger, in Mali and in Lomé, Togo’s capital. He launched this business in 1995 and sells his wares at 103 Wahala St. He is requesting a loan to purchase 50 leather hides and five boxes of glue.

loans.use: Purchasing leather  hides and glue

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kossi Ninyo

texts.fr: Monsieur  kossi  a  43 ans  avec  3 enfants. Il  est né  à   Amégnran   et  habite   quartier  Nukafu. Il  fait  le commerce  de vitres  et  cadre  de  photo pour s’occuper  de ses  enfants.  Il a reçu  2  crédits  de Wages  qu’elle a bien remboursé déjà.  Il a débuté  son activité en  1998  et  revend  sur le Boulevard  Jean  Paul  II.   Il s’approvisionne au Ghana  à  Accra. Il  sollicite   un  prêt  pour  acheter  100 barres  de  vitre.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi is 43 years old and has three children. He was born in Amégnan and lives in the Nukafu district. He sells photo frames and framing glass in order to support his children. He obtained two loans from WAGES in the past and repaid them already. He launched his activity in 1998. He sells at the Jean Paul II Boulevard. He stocks up in Accra in Ghana. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase 100  framing sets.

loans.use: Purchasing photo frames and glass

loans.name: Rumana

texts.en: Rumana is currently in the business of selling sorghum and maize. She is 25 years old, married to a businessman, with two children. One of them goes to school. Rumana borrowed a loan to stock more sorghum and maize to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more sorghum and maize to sell

loans.name: Friends United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Friends United” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 400,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K.. Kadiatu is age 35; she was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing, together with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and her children are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells biscuits, sardines, sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, etc. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy biscuits, sardines, sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her working capital

loans.name: Margaret Charo

texts.en:
Margaret Charo T. is a 31-year old lady  She is married to Charo, and they have two children.  Margaret runs a retail shop and she has been in this business for the last six years. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.   She plans to purchase cooking oil, flour, maize meal and soft drinks for sale. She will use the anticipated profits  to support and increase the business, as she hopes to grow it and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, flour, maize meal and soft drinks

loans.name: Linda Nazi

texts.en:
Linda Nazi J. is 34-year old lady from Changamwe. She has been in the education sector for the last six years. She runs a nursery school.  Her business is doing well.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.   She plans to purchase cement, soil and stones to build additional classrooms. Linda will direct the anticipated income into the improvement of the school. 


In the future, Linda’s dream is to expand the school into a primary school.

loans.use: To purchase cement, soil and stones to build additional classrooms

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik G. lives in Sarnashen village of Syunik region which is famous for its severe cold climate. The best agricultural business for the locals is cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. Knarik is married with two children. The family lives with Knarik’s in-laws. 

The family keeps a small cattle herd and also cultivates their land. This is the main source of income for Knarik’s household. Knarik has already started the prep work for the spring. To insure that she and her husband are able to undertake all the necessary tasks, she has applied to SEF for a loan to acquire seeds and gasoline to transport their agricultural produce.

loans.use: seeds and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu M. R., 33 years old, is married to Mwinyi and they have six children. Mwanatumu has been running a food kiosk for the last two years. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, a sack of sugar, fruits and vegetables. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business premise. Her dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married.

In 2008, Wissam opened his own shop selling home appliances. He is becoming well-known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to extend his shop, install shutters, and increase his inventory. He is planning to expand and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Extend the shop, install shutters, and increase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Siroko region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a small retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  

In the future, Esther hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her manage to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak G. lives in the village of Hatsavan, Syunik region. His family consists of four people. They are all engaged in agriculture. The family has beehives, a plot of land and a farm. Artak is currently doing preparation work to insure he is ready for spring planting. To insure a good harvest, Artak has applied for a small loan to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery goods

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Jalia has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food at home.  In the future, Jalia hopes to own a plot of land. Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business by getting enough working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Agnes has a small retail shop, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes contribute to school fees for her daughter.  In the future, Agnes hopes to expand the small retail shop into a big shop.   

Agnes is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by allowing her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Judith has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business selling milk  

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more milk for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Judith hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her sister.  

In the future, Judith hopes to take a course in hairdressing. Judith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by getting her more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Saum has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for 7 years.  She also has a second business selling clothes  

To help expand her business, Saum has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saum hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Saum hopes to own a plot of land and build a house. Saum is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to get more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria Efigenia

texts.es: Maria Efigenia tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es el único medio de ingreso, pues así puede ayudar con el gasto de su vivienda, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo a quienes tienes que proporcionarle alimentos, estudios, educación y vestimenta. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otros productos necesarios. Sueña con aumentar su negocio y ofrecer una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Efigenia is 49 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in the business for more than 7 years and it is her only source of income.  It enables her to help with her household expenses.  She has three children in her care whom she has to feed, clothe and educate.

María Efigenia will use her loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products.  She dreams of expanding her business and being able to offer her customers a large variety of products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ali Mohamed

texts.en: Ali Mohamed D., 31 years old, is married to Mwanaidi and he is the father of four children. Ali has been in the transport sector for the last year and his business is doing well. This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and to renovate his rental houses. Ali plans to use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle so that he can meet his customers' demands. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Irene has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Irene hopes to expand her business. Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by supporting her with a loan that has helped her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Fatumah has a business selling shoes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Fatumah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatumah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Fatumah hopes to own a small retail shop.     Fatumah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by letting her hear good storybooks in the club.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Nuriyla

texts.en:
Nuriyla K., 38, is married and has three children. She was born in the north of Kyrgyzstan and got married there. In 1995, she and her family moved to Belovodskoe, near the capital Bishkek. They rented a room and started to work at the local grocery store - Nuriyla as a seller and her husband as a guard. After five years, when their life became stable, Nuriyla decided to start her own business selling clothes at the local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong effort and hard work. With an initial capital of 20,000 KGS, she managed to develop her business and purchase a small selling venue at the market. With the great support of her husband, Bolot, and her elder daughter, Altynay, this activity became a good example of a family business. With the revenues, Nuriyla and Bolot bought a house and held their daughter’s marriage.

Nuriyla has now applied for a loan of 80,000 KGS to expand her assortment of goods. With the revenues, she plans to purchase the neighboring premises to enlarge the scale of her business. In the future, Nuriyla dreams of opening a big shop with different kinds of clothes.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  Sarah has a business selling soft drinks, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase another fridge to put more drinks in for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Sarah hopes to own a plot of land. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be able to save some money for herself.

loans.use: to purchase another fridge to put more drinks in for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Edith has a small restaurant that sells cooked food, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to stock more food to cook for sale.   With the help of the loan from BRAC, Edith hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Edith hopes to open another branch of her restaurant. Edith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be hard-working so as to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase more raw food to stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Esther has a business selling raw food, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. 

 In the future, Esther hopes to own a plot of land. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by supporting her through giving her a loan to improve her business so she can be hard-working. That has changed her life.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: China Shova

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Chini Shova T..  She is married and has one child, aged 30.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her shop.  

In the future, Chini Shova plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called  "pasal", are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:

 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Kakiya

texts.en:
Kakiya N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and presently has no children. Kakiya has a business selling shoes, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Kakiya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kakiya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Kakiya hopes to build rental houses. 

Kakiya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Almabubu

texts.en:
Almabubu  A. is a 63 year old pensioner who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is widowed and has eleven grown children; ten of them live on their own and the youngest son lives with her and helps in the household. In 1970, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Almabubu decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With a starting capital of 8,000 KGS, she managed to expand her farm. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastured her livestock in mountainous areas with native grasses. With the revenues, she was able to give good dowries to her daughters and provide them with all they needed.

Almabubu's farm now amounts to one cow and five sheep. She plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her business and hold her son’s marriage. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase braids and oil for the hair

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam B. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Zam has a medical clinic, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zam hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Zam hopes to own a small cosmetics shop.  

Zam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving more on her business and now that she has enough capital and also getting also new friends.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 23 años, vive con su madre, es soltero, y junto a su madre trabajan en una granja de pollo, este negocio lo inicio hace varios años la mamá de Juan, crían los pollos y salen a ofrecerlos ya alineados, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer la venta y actualmente necesita capital para invertir y reparar algunas paredes en su vivienda.
Por lo que Solicita un préstamo para comprar pollo, comprar materiales de construcción como arena y cemento, ya que esta inversión le ayudara a continuar en actividad con la granja y de igual manera a mejorara las condiciones actuales de su vivienda.
Las proyecciones de Juan son que su negocio continúe creciendo, conocer más clientes, proveer las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 23 years old, who lives with his mother. He is single and he works alongside his mother in a poultry farm. Juan's mother started this business several years ago, raising poultry and selling the meat. He doesn't have a fixed schedule to make his sales. He needs capital funds to invest and to repair the walls of his house. 

He requests a loan to purchase poultry and to purchase construction materials such as sand and cement. This investment will help him continue with his poultry farm and he will also be able to carry out some maintenance to his house. 

Juan's plans are to keep his business growing, to gain more clients, and to earn enough income to help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zulma Arely

texts.es:
Zulma, reside en San Rafael  Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con esposo y sus hijos. El negocio de Zulma lo inicio junto a su esposo, no tienen horario fijo de atención y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en cerdos.
Este préstamo le ayudara porque el sueño de ella es aumentar la granja y mejorar la comercialización de los cerdos,se podría decir que esta inversion está abonando al cumplimiento del sueño de Zulma, aunque siempre se corre el riesgo de que más de algún cerdo pueda enfermar o morir, siendo así una perdida para ella.
texts.en:
Zulma lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. She has a pig farm and she lives with her husband and children. Zulma started her business together with her husband. They don't have a fixed work schedule and currently she needs to invest in her pig farm. 

This loan will help her because her dream is to expand her farm and to improve the sale of livestock. It is fair to say that this investment is making Zulma's dream a reality. Although there is always a risk that a pig might fall ill or die, translating into a loss for her.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia D. 25 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia conformada por: su esposo y un hijo D. un año D. edad, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, este oficio lo inicio con ayuda D. su esposo, no tiene un horario especifico para atender los oficios que implica y actualmente necesita D. un préstamo para comprar cerdos, ya que entre más pueda tener es mejor para el momento D. comercializar, a parte que este negocio es la fuente D. ingreso para el hogar, por lo tanto debe permanecer varios cerdos en la granja.
Espera realizar una buena compra que le permita en un futuro tener ingresos, aunque siempre tiene un riesgo es que se le enfermen y puedan morir. Pero Claudia es muy optimista y considera que todo le saldrá bien creciendo con el negocio y aumentar su clientela con esto pues que sea más estable su condición económica.
texts.en:
Claudia is 25 years old and she lives in Santa Elena in the department of Usulutan. She lives with her family, which is maD. up of her husband and her 1-year old son. She has a pig farm and she started this business together with her husband. She doesn't have a specific schedule to attend to the business. She requires a loan to purchase pigs. The more livestock she is able to have the better it will be when it's time to sell. This business is the source of income for the household and so she needs to always have many pigs in the farm. 

She hopes to acquire a good buy which will help her obtain better earnings in the future, although there is always a risk that the livestock might fall ill or die. Claudia is very optimistic and she believes that everything will be well with the expansion of her business. She will increase her clientele with this support and she will gain greater financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anju D..  She is married and has two children aged 16 and 11.  In 2000, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

 In the future, Anju plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work with their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:

 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rubenia De Jesus

texts.es: Rubenia De Jesús tiene 50 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería es una persona muy humilde, pues siempre busca la forma de salir adelante, ella ha obtenido mucha experiencia con este negocio. Es así que decide que con su pequeña pulpería sobrevivir. Con este financiamiento comprara productos como refrescos, pan, detergentes y pollo. Desea tener una casa más grande para que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Rubenia De Jesús is 50 years old.  Her business is a grocery store.  Rubenia is a very humble person who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life.  She has a lot of experience in her business.  Her grocery store helps her to survive.

Rubenia will use her loan to buy products such as soft drinks, bread, detergents and chicken.  She would like to have a larger house so that she can turn her business into a wholesalers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora M. S. María de los Ángeles, tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña María es una persona que por su situación económica no pudo ingresar a la universidad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, tomo la decisión de ser comerciante ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y María tuvo que asumir la responsabilidad.
Es su primer crédito, se entero de los servicios que ofrece la fundación por medio de una cliente de capacitación , con el crédito piensa invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para tener más capital de trabajo ya que María ha enfrentado algunas  enfermedades  y abandono un poco su negocio
María empezó en el comercio hace 25 años, tuvo un capital por empezar de 100,000.00 los cuales fueron prestados por su esposo, Doña María hace las labores domesticas en la pura mañana y durante la tarde se la dedica a vender, cobrar y a coser
Este crédito  será de gran   ayuda a su negocio ya que ha quedado descapitalizado y con el crédito podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y tener más capital de trabajo
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles M. S. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  Owing to her financial situation, María couldn't go to university.  She is a very hard-working and responsible person who took the decision to become a saleswoman since her husband lost his job and she had to take responsibility.

This is María's first loan.  She found out about the services that Fundación Mujer offer through a training client.  She plans to invest her loan in buying merchandise so that she has more working capital as she has faced a number of illnesses and had to leave her business for a while.  María started out 25 years ago with 100,000 'colones' in capital from her husband.  María does her housework in the morning and in the afternoon she sells, collects payments and sews.

This loan will be a great help to María's business since she has been without capital and this loan will enable her to improve her quality of life and have more working capital available.

loans.use: To have more working capital so that she can keep investing

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, D. 64 años,  vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su madre, su esposo Edgar (60),  D. su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieta, todos muy unidos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte D. la ciudad.

DesD. hace dos años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. muebles D. madera como estantes, vitrinas, camas, y están ubicados en la parte D. afuera D. su casa. Dice que se le ocurrió instalar este negocio, pues la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido captar buenos clientes en poco tiempo. Y  le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo considera tranquilo y rentable, porque aunque atienD. sola cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo o nuera. Cada vez tiene mayor variedad D. muebles que ofrece a su clientela que la visita con frecuencia, por el buen acabado y calidad D. su mercadería.
